intro: Pilosella arrhenii, commonly known as the male meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Pilosella arrhenii is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a short-lived perennial species.
